question: Which of the following is known as an off-stump?
option1: The stump on the same side as batsman’s legs
option2: The stump in the centre of the three stumps
option3: The stump on the side of batsman’s bat
option4: The stump on either side of the middle stump
answer: The stump on the side of batsman’s bat
explanation: The stumps are three vertical posts which support two bails. They are usually made of wood, most commonly being ash. Each stump has a specific name. The off-stump is the one the off side of the wicket i.e. the same side as the batsman’s bat.
